page.title: 09Earlsfield and Wandsworth
page.content: Springfield Hospital, once a mental hospital, is now very enclosed. It used to have a farm next to it where the patients helped feed the animals.It has now gone but the patients still do their own cooking, etc.A comprehensive school for 2000 girls was once a home for orphans. Its grounds were once a large playing field called Spencer Park.The roads are full of noisy vehicles.You used to be able to cross thd without looking because there were no cars as they were very expensive at the time.The shops are not really suitable for serious shopping.They are very small and many of them have been shut down.Still open are the David Greig greengrocers and butchers.There used to be a shoe shop,chemist,three banks and a leather shop.Now there are just car accessory shops.
